docs.lead_paragraph: On the eve of the Fourth of July - a pyrotechnical celebration made even brighter and noisier by this centennial of the Statue of Liberty - Donald Lavert Rogers was buried in a quiet service in Sacramento, Calif. The Cleveland Browns' star safety died a week ago yesterday of cardiac arrest brought on by cocaine. He was 23 years old and was to be married the next day. He died eight days after Len Bias, the college basketball star, died, also of cocaine abuse.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following are excerpts from opinions by the Supreme Court today in its decision that the Constitution does not protect private homosexual relations between consenting adults. Justice Byron R. White wrote the majority opinion, joined by Chief Justice Warren E. Burger and Justices Lewis F. Powell Jr., William H. Rehnquist and Sandra Day O'Connor. Chief Justice Burger and Justice Powell wrote concurring opinions. Justice Harry A. Blackmun wrote a dissenting opinion, joined by Justices William J. Brennan Jr., Thurgood Marshall and John Paul Stevens. Justice Stevens wrote a separate dissenting opinion, joined by Justices Brennan and Marshall. From the Opinion By Justice White In August 1982, respondent was charged with violating the Georgia statute criminalizing sodomy by committing that act with another adult male in the bedroom of respondent's home. After a preliminary hearing, the District Attorney decided not to present the matter to the grand jury unless further evidence developed. (In a footnote, the court said: Ga. Code ann. section 16-6-2(1984) provides, in pertinent part, as follows: ''(a) A person commits the offense of sodomy when he performs or submits to any sexual act involving the sex organs of one person and the mouth or anus of another. . . .

headline.main: EXCERPTS FROM THE COURT OPINIONS ON HOMOSEXUAL RELATIONS
